main event: A white, star-like object was observed for 15 minutes, pulsating and changing brightness over Adair AFS, Oregon on February 28, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared and disappeared from view several times within the 15-minute observation period.
The object faded, then suddenly brightened and illuminated the surrounding area.
The object remained stationary and the disappearance was likely due to clouds moving between the witnesses and the object.
The object was described as having exceptional brilliance and size, with a diameter the size of a pencil eraser at arm's length.
The analysis concluded the object was most likely a re-entry of an Earth satellite.
